Of all the environmental factors, water is most important. Without water other factors will not exert effect. Once moistened, the wetness degree, temperature and light intensity would all significantly affect biocrusts
6, 7, 12, 29– 31 . However, the natural biocrusts are inactive in more than 90% time due to desiccation
32 . So the present detections of CO 2 exchange in biocrusts were performed either under indoor simulation experiments that artificially added water
33– 38 , or after rainfall
39 . Additionally, a striking advantage of biocrusts was their utilization of non-rainfall water (NRW), which occurred ca. 270 nights every year
40, 41 and accounted for a high proportion of the total annual precipitation
42 , even was the only water source
43– 46 . Some also suggested that NRW was of great importance in carbon balance of biocrusts
9 . However, by now there are few studies on the NRW utilization by biocrusts.
